meanings.definition: To transition from an industrial economy to a post-industrial economy.
meanings.sent1: The city is deindustrializing, moving away from factories to focus on technology.
meanings.sent2: Countries are deindustrializing as they embrace new forms of production.
meanings.sent3: The old machines in the factory are sad to see the deindustrializing trend.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was deindustrializing, shifting from routine to creativity.
meanings.sent5: The process of deindustrializing can be challenging but rewarding in the long run.

meanings.definition: The process of reducing industrial activity in a region.
meanings.sent1: Deindustrializing can lead to job losses in the area.
meanings.sent2: The deindustrializing of the town caused economic changes for the residents.
meanings.sent3: The deindustrializing of the city made the air cleaner and the streets quieter.
meanings.sent4: The deindustrializing of the region was like watching a giant machine slowly power down.
meanings.sent5: The effects of deindustrializing were visible in the abandoned factories and empty warehouses.
